title: Help me pick a 6300 champ
body:
OK, so I've been saving for a while for a 6300 IP champ, and I'm sort of stuck in deciding who to pick.

I have either {{champion:236}} , {{champion:412}} , {{champion:127}} ,or {{champion:201}}  

I'm a Jungler Main that is simply expanding my champion pool (since I tend to fill in my matches

These four, I have LOVED playing as when they were free to play, and I'm now deciding which to pick. I'll state my play styles for each champ to help you decide (please bear with me :) )

{{champion:236}} 
What I loved about Lucian is his caster style of ADC. mixing in spells and AA in combat. I also love how he's so slippery, and his ulti is pretty much a drive by XD
I though didn't like his base AD damage, and that his performance really drops when he's OOM

{{champion:412}} 
This guy is quite popular pick for support, and I get why. Tanky, a hook, good peel with flay, the lantern that saves lives, and the box that makes it so frustrating to catch or run away. Also, unlike most supports, he can actually fight when needed.

Hate about him though is he has little to nothing to help him escape when his ADC is dead (box is most likely used already, and all thats left is a little lantern shield)

{{champion:201}} 

I decided to play this macho man since he's free to play this week, and I just love how his kit revolves around "protect the ADC", since that is usually my mindset as a supp.

His Q, W, E all work well at this task. And, if that isn't enough, he even adds his ultimate into the mix.

Though, downside is he's no dualist and dies rather easily when teammates die, as his only form of escape relies on nearby allied minions.

{{champion:127}} 
This mage champ is so great with her kit. A range poke, a position changer, a stun, and a ulti that either becomes a {{item:3157}} + slow, or a stun + slow.
Also, have seen her top lane, as her kit is basically anti-melee
Downsides is that her E is slow and at times unreliable. Her stun is hard to use esp. against high mobile champs, and her Ulti forces her at times into a bad position (i dunno. maybe that's just me)

So, if you've read through my ranting, Thank you. So, please help a fellow summoner out? Thank you in advance.

replies.body: imo liss is the best choice shes pretty fun and pretty strong and you can play her mid top and even support/jungle if you wanna figure that out
I have seen top Liss work wonders on juggernauts due to the fact they build armor. Thank you for your opinion. Cookie for you{{item:2009}}

You should try full tank liss jungle. Rlly fun, her first clear is trash but you're a jungle main so I think you'll find her kit really strong for team fights and ganks. It's not good, but you'll have a LOT of fun playing it 

She's also dope mid/top. Thing is, though shes not that strong against mages that can poke her, she counters a lot of popular champs. Zed at 6 can't kill her, Fizz cannot trade with her effectively, Yasuo also will get rektd, she's extremely hard to burst down but also herself has a lot of burst. 

Her ult is fine if you try not to use it on yourself unless you REALLY need it. It's why Zhoynas is so core on her, she can E in, ult someone and zhoynas before she gets blown up.
I say liss mostly because I wanna see more diversity and not the same chants every game. Also she's really fun and can play top or mid
I barely see Liss being played in EUW, even if I think she's a monster when fed. Well, thank you for your opinion. Cookie ^^{{item:2010}}
Lissandra is the easiest to climb with although thresh is the best overall.
why is lissandra the easiest to climb with? Thresh depends on team clicking lanterns and using his engages correctly

Lissandra has a kit that allows her to play top or mid and is relatively simple. Ult is point and click. Q is a simple skillshot. No brainer passive. W is click root and she is safe. That is a huge thing at low elo to about gold. If you can be safe and not feed and just cs effectively you will almost always win. Also she doesn't take any communication with your team during ganks which is great for solo Q. Your only job during ganks is to use your point and click cc to lock up the kill. 

Thresh, while he does take communication from his team, is the best overall. You can play him every single game and never worry about being countered because his kit is so versatile that he can play against anyone effectively
Thank you, but I haven't tried the Ekko and am simply waiting for his FTP moment
I'd say Braum. There's something really satisfying about seeing "-800" :D
